intro: Spermacoce multiflora, commonly known as the many-flowered moonflower, is a tropical plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its showy, white, night-blooming flowers that emit a sweet fragrance. The plant produces small, spherical fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds. It is native to regions in Africa, Asia, and the Americas. Spermacoce multiflora is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its aesthetic appeal and unique flowering behavior.
